tested_features: Home Page (/) - Daily check-in, affirmations, playlists, trending, artists, specialized categories, radio
Mood Page (/mood) - 4-dimensional mood selection (Mood, Feeling, Vibe, Genre)
Search Page (/search) - Search functionality UI
Collection/Library Page (/collection) - User's saved content
Artist Pages (/artist/[id]) - Artist profile, tracks, albums
Album Pages (/album/[id]) - Album details, track listing
Playlist Pages (/playlist/[id]) - Playlist details, tracks
Check-in Page (/check-in) - Daily mood check-in system
Journal Page (/journal) - Journaling system
Affirmations Page (/affirmations) - Affirmations library
Wellness Page (/wellness) - Mental health resource hub
Radio Page (/radio) - Radio stations platform
Rewards Page (/rewards) - Points & rewards catalog
Upload Page (/upload) - Track upload with mandatory mood tags
Artist Signup Page (/artist/signup) - 6-step legal signup workflow
Artist Dashboard (/dashboard/artist) - Artist analytics and management
Profile Page (/profile) - User profile
Player Component - Audio playback controls, progress, volume, queue, PiP
Sidebar Component - Navigation, collapsible
TopBar Component - Search, points, streak, user menu
RightSidebar Component - Track credits and info
State Management - 9 Zustand stores with localStorage persistence
Build System - Next.js 14, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
Linting & Type Checking - ESLint, TypeScript strict mode

issues.description: CRITICAL: TypeScript build error - Property 'composer' does not exist on type 'Track' in RightSidebar.tsx:98
repro_steps: 1. Run `npm run build`
2. Build fails with: Property 'composer' does not exist on type 'Track'
issues.fix_suggestion: Either add 'composer' property to Track interface in types/track.ts, or remove the conditional rendering in RightSidebar.tsx:98-103
issues.verification: Run `npm run build` - should complete without errors
issues.logs: Type error: Property 'composer' does not exist on type 'Track' at components/RightSidebar.tsx:98:32
issues.impact: Blocks production build - application cannot be deployed

issues.description: Performance: 17 instances of `` tags instead of Next.js `` component - impacts LCP and bandwidth

2. See 17 warnings about using `` instead of ``
3. Check Lighthouse performance score - likely <90 for LCP

issues.description: MISSING: No OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect implementation - marked as complete in requirements but no actual implementation exists
repro_steps: 1. Check for API routes: `ls app/api` - returns empty/no directory
2. Search codebase for OAuth/authentication: `grep -r 'oauth\|OAuth\|auth' app/` - no implementation found
3. User menu exists but has no actual auth functionality
issues.fix_suggestion:
Implement OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect:
1. Create `app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts` or use NextAuth.js
2. Set up OAuth providers (Google, Apple, Spotify)
3. Implement JWT token validation
4. Add refresh token mechanism
5. Update UserMenu component to handle login/logout
6. Add protected route middleware
issues.verification:
1. User can log in via OAuth providers
2. JWT tokens are validated
3. Protected routes redirect to login
4. User session persists across page reloads
issues.logs: No OAuth implementation found - requirements checklist incorrectly marks this as complete
issues.impact: Application cannot authenticate users - critical for production launch

issues.description: MISSING: No API routes exist (`app/api` directory doesn't exist) - all features marked as 'ready for API replacement' are non-functional
repro_steps: 1. Check for API directory: `ls -la app/` - no `api/` directory exists
2. All data comes from mock JSON files in `data/mock/`
3. No real backend integration possible
issues.fix_suggestion:
Create API routes:
1. `app/api/tracks/route.ts` - GET tracks, POST upload
2. `app/api/artists/route.ts` - Artist CRUD
3. `app/api/playlists/route.ts` - Playlist management
4. `app/api/auth/route.ts` - Authentication
5. `app/api/mood/route.ts` - Mood tag queries
6. `app/api/check-in/route.ts` - Daily check-ins
7. `app/api/journal/route.ts` - Journal entries
8. Implement rate limiting, input validation (Zod), error handling
issues.verification:
1. API routes return real data (not mock)
2. POST/PUT/DELETE operations work
3. Rate limiting is enforced
4. Input validation rejects invalid data
issues.logs: No API routes found - application relies entirely on mock data
issues.impact: All data is static/mock - no persistence, no real functionality

issues.description: MISSING: No subscription tiers management UI - critical monetization feature marked as missing in GAP_ANALYSIS.md
repro_steps: 1. Search for subscription page: No `/subscription` or `/settings/subscription` route exists
2. UserMenu shows hardcoded 'Premium' tier
3. No upgrade/downgrade flows exist
issues.fix_suggestion:
Create subscription management:
1. `app/subscription/page.tsx` - Subscription management page
2. Tier comparison cards (Free vs Premium vs Artist)
3. Upgrade/downgrade CTAs throughout app
4. Subscription status indicator in UserMenu
5. Payment method management UI (integrate Stripe)
6. Subscription status store (useSubscriptionStore)
issues.verification:
1. User can view subscription tiers
2. User can upgrade/downgrade (UI ready for Stripe integration)
3. Subscription status updates in UserMenu
4. Tier-based feature gating works
issues.logs: GAP_ANALYSIS.md identifies this as CRITICAL missing feature
issues.impact: Cannot monetize the platform - critical for launch

issues.description: MISSING: No ad system UI - required for free tier monetization
repro_steps: 1. No ad banner components exist
2. No interstitial ad player between tracks
3. No PSA display system
4. No contextual ad targeting logic
issues.fix_suggestion:
Implement ad system:
1. Create `components/AdBanner.tsx` - Matches Spotify style
2. Create `components/InterstitialAd.tsx` - Plays between tracks
3. Create `components/PSADisplay.tsx` - Wellness PSAs
4. Add ad placement logic in Player component (between tracks)
5. Add ad slots in home feed
6. Implement tier-based ad display (Free tier only)
issues.verification:
1. Free tier users see ads between tracks
2. Premium users see no ads
3. PSAs display appropriately
4. Ad targeting respects user mood/wellness context
issues.logs: GAP_ANALYSIS.md identifies this as CRITICAL missing feature
issues.impact: Free tier cannot generate revenue - critical for business model

Create merch store:

2. `app/merch/[id]/page.tsx` - Product detail pages
3. `components/MerchCart.tsx` - Shopping cart component

6. Fulfillment integration UI (ready for backend)
issues.verification:

2. Add to cart functionality works
3. Cart persists in localStorage
4. Checkout UI is ready for payment integration
issues.logs: GAP_ANALYSIS.md identifies this as missing feature
issues.impact: Missed revenue opportunity - high priority for launch

issues.description: Security: No actual security implementation - CSRF, XSS prevention, rate limiting exist only in documentation, not code
repro_steps: 1. Search for CSRF protection: `grep -r 'csrf\|CSRF' app/` - no implementation
2. Search for XSS sanitization: `grep -r 'sanitize\|escape' app/` - minimal/none
3. No API routes means no rate limiting implementation
4. No Content Security Policy headers configured
issues.fix_suggestion:
Implement security:
1. Add CSRF tokens to forms (middleware or API routes)
2. Sanitize user inputs (DOMPurify for XSS prevention)
3. Configure CSP headers in `next.config.js`
4. Add rate limiting middleware (Redis-based)
5. Validate all inputs with Zod schemas
6. Implement SQL injection prevention (Prisma handles, but verify)
7. Add security headers (HSTS, X-Frame-Options, etc.)
issues.verification:
1. Forms include CSRF tokens
2. XSS attacks are blocked (test with `<script>` injection)
3. Rate limiting prevents abuse
4. Security headers are present in response
issues.logs: COMPLETE_REQUIREMENTS_CHECKLIST.md marks security as complete, but no actual implementation found
issues.impact: Application is vulnerable to common web attacks - critical security risk

issues.description: Accessibility: Limited ARIA labels and WCAG 2.2 compliance - only basic labels present, comprehensive audit needed
files: Multiple components - only 6 aria-label instances found
repro_steps: 1. Search for ARIA: `grep -ri 'aria-' app/ components/` - only 6 instances found
2. Many interactive elements lack ARIA labels
3. No keyboard navigation testing documented
4. Color contrast not verified (WCAG 2.2 requires >4.5:1)
issues.fix_suggestion:
Enhance accessibility:
1. Add ARIA labels to all interactive elements (buttons, links, inputs)
2. Implement keyboard navigation for all features
3. Test with screen readers (VoiceOver, NVDA)
4. Verify color contrast ratios (>4.5:1 for text)
5. Add skip navigation links
6. Ensure focus indicators are visible
7. Add role attributes where needed
8. Test with keyboard-only navigation
9. Run automated accessibility audit (axe-core, Lighthouse)
issues.verification:
1. All interactive elements have ARIA labels
2. Full keyboard navigation works
3. Screen reader announces elements correctly
4. Color contrast passes WCAG 2.2 AA
5. Lighthouse accessibility score >90
issues.logs: Only 6 aria-label instances found across entire codebase - insufficient for WCAG 2.2 compliance
issues.impact: Application may not be accessible to users with disabilities - legal/compliance risk

issues.description: Error Handling: Minimal error handling - no try/catch blocks for API calls (which don't exist), no error boundaries for components
repro_steps: 1. Search for error handling: `grep -r 'try\|catch' app/ components/` - only 5 instances found
2. No error boundaries for component failures
3. Audio player errors not handled gracefully
4. File upload errors not displayed to user
issues.fix_suggestion:
Implement comprehensive error handling:
1. Add Error Boundary component for React error catching
2. Wrap API calls in try/catch blocks
3. Display user-friendly error messages
4. Log errors to monitoring service (Sentry, LogRocket)
5. Handle audio player errors (network, format issues)
6. Validate file uploads with clear error messages
7. Add retry logic for failed API calls
issues.verification:
1. Component errors don't crash entire app
2. API errors show user-friendly messages
3. Audio playback errors are handled gracefully
4. Errors are logged for debugging
issues.logs: Only 5 try/catch blocks found - insufficient error handling coverage
issues.impact: Poor user experience when errors occur - application may appear broken

issues.description: Performance: Player component updates progress every 100ms (10fps) instead of recommended 60fps (16.67ms) - requirement says 60fps
repro_steps: 1. Check `lib/player.ts` line 36: `setInterval(..., 100)` - updates every 100ms
2. Requirement states '60fps smooth updates' (16.67ms interval)
3. Progress bar may appear choppy on slower devices
issues.verification:
1. Progress bar updates smoothly at 60fps
2. No performance degradation on low-end devices
3. CPU usage remains acceptable
issues.logs: player.ts line 36: setInterval with 100ms (10fps) instead of 16.67ms (60fps) as per requirements
issues.impact: Progress bar updates may appear choppy - not meeting requirement specification

issues.description: Input Validation: Missing validation for form inputs - file upload, artist signup, metadata forms lack comprehensive validation
repro_steps: 1. Upload page accepts files without size/format validation
2. Artist signup forms have no input sanitization
3. Email validation may be missing
4. No max length validation on text inputs
issues.fix_suggestion:
Add input validation:
1. File upload: Validate file size (max 500MB), format (WAV/FLAC/MP3/M4A/MP4), MIME type
2. Form inputs: Max length, required fields, email format
3. Use Zod schemas for validation
4. Display validation errors inline
5. Sanitize all text inputs
6. Prevent XSS in user-generated content
issues.verification:
1. File upload rejects invalid formats/sizes
2. Form validation shows errors before submission
3. XSS attempts are blocked
4. All inputs have appropriate constraints
issues.logs: No comprehensive input validation found in upload/signup forms
issues.impact: Security vulnerabilities, poor UX, invalid data entry

issues.description: State Management: Potential memory leaks - progress interval in audio player not cleaned up in all cases
repro_steps: 1. Check `lib/player.ts` - `progressInterval` cleanup only in `unload()` method
2. If component unmounts without calling `unload()`, interval persists
3. Multiple track loads without cleanup could accumulate intervals
issues.verification:
1. No intervals persist after component unmount
2. Memory usage doesn't increase over time
3. Performance remains stable during extended use
issues.logs: progressInterval cleanup only in unload() - may not be called in all scenarios
issues.impact: Memory leaks could degrade performance over time

issues.description: Browser Compatibility: Picture-in-Picture API usage without feature detection - may fail on unsupported browsers
repro_steps: 1. Check `PictureInPicturePlayer.tsx` - uses `documentPictureInPicture` API
2. No feature detection before usage
3. Will throw errors in Firefox, older browsers
issues.verification:
1. PiP button hidden on unsupported browsers
2. No console errors in Firefox/Safari
3. Graceful degradation works
issues.logs: PictureInPicturePlayer uses API without feature detection
issues.impact: Application may throw errors on unsupported browsers - poor UX

issues.description: Data Persistence: All state persists to localStorage but no data migration/versioning strategy - breaking changes could corrupt user data
files: stores/*.ts - all use Zustand persist middleware
repro_steps: 1. Check Zustand stores - all use `persist` middleware with localStorage
2. No version field or migration logic
3. Schema changes could break existing user data
issues.verification:
1. Version field added to all persisted stores
2. Migration logic handles schema changes
3. Old data migrates successfully to new schema
issues.logs: No versioning/migration strategy for localStorage data
issues.impact: Future updates could corrupt user's saved data

issues.description: Responsive Design: No mobile-specific testing or breakpoints verified - application may not work well on mobile devices
repro_steps: 1. Test application on mobile viewport (<768px)
2. Sidebar may not collapse appropriately
3. Player bar may not fit on small screens
4. Grid layouts may break on mobile
issues.fix_suggestion:
Test and fix responsive design:
1. Test all pages at 320px, 375px, 414px (mobile)
2. Ensure sidebar collapses on mobile
3. Player controls stack vertically on small screens
4. Grid layouts use responsive columns (1 col on mobile)
5. Touch targets are at least 44x44px
6. Test on real iOS/Android devices
issues.verification:
1. All pages work on mobile viewports
2. Touch interactions work correctly
3. Text is readable without zooming
4. No horizontal scrolling
issues.logs: No mobile testing documented or verified
issues.impact: Poor mobile user experience - majority of users may be on mobile

issues.description: Missing Tests: No unit tests, integration tests, or E2E tests found - requirements mention testing but no test files exist
files: No test files found in codebase
repro_steps: 1. Search for test files: `find . -name '*.test.*' -o -name '*.spec.*'` - returns empty
2. No test directory (`__tests__`, `tests`, `.test`)
3. Requirements checklist marks testing as complete but no tests exist
issues.fix_suggestion:
Add comprehensive testing:
1. Unit tests for stores (Vitest/Jest)
2. Component tests (React Testing Library)
3. Integration tests for API routes
4. E2E tests for critical flows (Playwright/Cypress)
5. Audio player testing
6. Visual regression testing (Percy/Chromatic)
issues.verification:
1. Test suite runs successfully
2. All critical paths have test coverage
3. CI/CD runs tests on every commit
4. Coverage >80% for critical components
issues.logs: No test files found despite requirements marking testing as complete
issues.impact: No way to verify functionality works - high risk of regressions

coverage_summary: 100% (all pages, components, and features tested via code review, build verification, and requirements comparison)
confidence: 0.95 (comprehensive static analysis completed, but dynamic/runtime testing would increase confidence to 0.99)
